Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Ran a Facebook and Instagram ad campaign targeting local food enthusiasts.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: Increased followers by 20%, but minimal impact on in-store visits.

Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Introduced a loyalty program offering a free meal after 10 purchases.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: Improved customer retention by 15%, but program management costs were high.

Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Sent monthly newsletters with special offers and event announcements.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: High open rate (40%) but low conversion to in-store visits (5%).

Growing Retention.Name: Loyalty Program Expansion
Growing Retention.Description: Implement a new tiered loyalty program that offers exclusive benefits and rewards to top-spending customers. The program will be promoted through in-store signage, email campaigns, and social media. It will run for three months and be available at all restaurant locations.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By offering exclusive benefits to top-spending customers, they will feel more valued and will be incentivized to return more frequently, leading to increased retention and higher customer lifetime value.
Metrics: Increase in repeat visits from top-spending customers
Growth in average spend per visit from loyalty program members
Number of new loyalty program sign-ups

Growing Retention.Name: Personalized Email Campaign
Growing Retention.Description: Utilize customer data to create personalized email offers based on past dining behavior. Offers will be tailored to each customer's preferences and dining history. The campaign will run for one month and target the restaurant's loyalty program members.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By sending personalized offers based on past dining behavior, customers will feel valued and more likely to return, resulting in increased retention and higher engagement with the loyalty program.
Metrics: Open rate and click-through rate of personalized emails
Increase in repeat visits from customers who received personalized offers

Growing Retention.Name: Service Quality Training Program
Growing Retention.Description: Implement a comprehensive service quality training program for all front-of-house staff. The training will focus on enhancing customer interactions, resolving issues, and creating memorable dining experiences. The program will be conducted over two months at all restaurant locations.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By consistently providing excellent service, customers will have a positive dining experience, leading to increased satisfaction, repeat visits, and higher retention rates.
Metrics: Customer satisfaction scores before and after training program
Number of positive customer reviews mentioning service quality

Growing Retention.Name: Social Media Engagement Challenge
Growing Retention.Description: Launch a social media engagement challenge where customers are encouraged to share their dining experiences using a specific hashtag. The challenge will run for one month and be promoted across all social media platforms. Participants will have the chance to win a free meal or other incentives.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By encouraging customers to engage on social media, the restaurant will stay top of mind for customers, leading to increased brand awareness, customer loyalty, and repeat visits.
Metrics: Number of user-generated posts using the challenge hashtag
Increase in social media followers and engagement during the challenge period
Impact on repeat visits from participants

Growing Retention.Name: Feedback-Based Menu Personalization
Growing Retention.Description: Implement a feedback-based menu personalization initiative where customers are invited to provide input on new menu items or modifications. The feedback will be used to tailor the menu to customer preferences. This initiative will be ongoing and promoted through in-store signage and digital platforms.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By incorporating customer feedback into the menu, customers will feel valued and more likely to return to try new items, leading to increased retention and higher customer satisfaction.
Metrics: Number of customer feedback submissions for menu items
Sales performance of new or modified menu items based on customer feedback
Change in customer satisfaction scores related to menu offerings
